clusters.title: Netflix announces deal to acquire Warner Brothers Discovery
clusters.neutral_headline: Netflix to Acquire Warner Bros. Discovery in Deal

items.title: Netflix announces deal to acquire Warner Brothers Discovery
items.standfirst: Netflix announces deal to acquire Warner Brothers Discovery Streaming giant Netflix said it's buying Warner Bros. Discovery in a deal that would create a global entertainment behemoth. CNN and other cable channels Warner Bros. owns are not part of the deal.
items.content: Netflix announces deal to acquire Warner Brothers Discovery Streaming giant Netflix said it's buying Warner Bros. Discovery in a deal that would create a global entertainment behemoth. CNN and other cable channels Warner Bros. owns are not part of the deal.

items.title: Here's what the Netflix-Warner Brothers deal means for consumers

items.title: Cinemas and unions sound alarms over Netflix-Warner Bros. deal
items.standfirst: Hollywood unions and trade groups raised concerns about the proposed tie-up between Netflix and Warner Bros.' film and TV studios, HBO and HBO Max.
items.content: Hollywood unions and trade groups raised concerns about the proposed tie-up between Netflix and Warner Bros.' film and TV studios, HBO and HBO Max.

items.standfirst: Netflix on Friday said it will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.
items.content: Netflix on Friday said it will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.

items.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros film and streaming businesses for $72bn
items.standfirst: The major Hollywood deal means Netflix will takeover ownership of franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.
items.content: The major Hollywood deal means Netflix will takeover ownership of franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.

items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in $72 Billion Cash, Stock Deal | Bloomberg Tech 12/5/2025
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: HPE’s AI Servers Ready as Soon Data Centers Are, Says CEO
items.standfirst: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix, Warner Bros. Face Road to Finalizing Deal
items.standfirst: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: The regulatory path ahead for a Netflix and Warner Bros. deal could get dicey
items.standfirst: The Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery deal came together quickly — but its path to regulatory approval may not be so speedy. Netflix stunned the media industry on Friday when it announced its proposed $72 billion deal to acquire the iconic Warner Bros. film studio and streaming service HBO Max.…
items.content: The Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery deal came together quickly — but its path to regulatory approval may not be so speedy. Netflix stunned the media industry on Friday when it announced its proposed $72 billion deal to acquire the iconic Warner Bros. film studio and streaming service HBO Max.…

items.title: Netflix Breaks From ‘Build, Not Buy’ With Warner Bros. Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix–Warner Bros. Deal Sets Up $72 Billion Antitrust Test
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. has won the heated takeover battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. Now it must convince global antitrust regulators that the deal won’t give it an illegal advantage in the streaming market.
items.content: Netflix Inc. has won the heated takeover battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. Now it must convince global antitrust regulators that the deal won’t give it an illegal advantage in the streaming market.

items.title: EU Can Regulate Tech, Bloc's US Ambassador Says
items.standfirst: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros Discovery, raising antitrust concerns
items.standfirst: Critics say the deal would create less competition in Hollywood and limit choice for consumers.
items.content: Critics say the deal would create less competition in Hollywood and limit choice for consumers.

items.title: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros studio, HBO Max for $72 billion
items.standfirst: Streaming giant Netflix has agreed to acquire Warner Bros studios and its streaming business for $72 billion, the two American companies announced in a statement on Friday. This acquisition would bring two of the industry’s biggest players in film and TV under one roof.
items.content: Streaming giant Netflix has agreed to acquire Warner Bros studios and its streaming business for $72 billion, the two American companies announced in a statement on Friday. This acquisition would bring two of the industry’s biggest players in film and TV under one roof.

items.title: Netflix will buy Warner Bros' studio and streaming businesses for $72 billion
items.standfirst: The merger, announced Friday, would bring two of the industry's biggest players in film and TV under one roof. Beyond its television and motion picture division, Warner owns HBO Max and DC Studios.
items.content: The merger, announced Friday, would bring two of the industry's biggest players in film and TV under one roof. Beyond its television and motion picture division, Warner owns HBO Max and DC Studios. (Image credit: Chris Pizzello)

items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in Historic $72 Billion Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.
items.content: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.

items.title: Musk’s X Fined as EU Escalates Free-Speech Clash With US
items.standfirst: Elon Musk’s X social network was slapped with a lower-than-expected €120 million ($140 million) fine for violating the European Union’s controversial content-moderation law, in a move still set to raise tensions with the White House over free speech and tech regulation.
items.content: Elon Musk’s X social network was slapped with a lower-than-expected €120 million ($140 million) fine for violating the European Union’s controversial content-moderation law, in a move still set to raise tensions with the White House over free speech and tech regulation.

items.title: Netflix agrees blockbuster $72bn deal for Warner Bros studios
items.standfirst: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game Of Thrones.
items.content: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game Of Thrones.

ai_summary: Netflix announced a deal to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery, creating a global entertainment company.
The deal does not include CNN or other cable channels owned by Warner Bros.
The acquisition is valued at $82.7 billion, according to CBS News reports.
Hollywood unions and trade groups expressed concerns about the proposed tie-up.
Antitrust regulators must approve the deal, which could impact the streaming market.

US Supreme Court agrees to hear case challenging birthright citizenship

items.content: The Supreme Court is likely to hear oral arguments early next year, with a ruling in June.

items.title: US Supreme Court to review Trump's order to restrict birthright citizenship
items.standfirst: The US Supreme Court agreed on Friday to review US President Donald Trump's order on birthright citizenship. Several lower courts have previously blocked Trump's bid to restrict the law that states anyone born on US soil is automatically an American citizen.
items.content: The US Supreme Court agreed on Friday to review US President Donald Trump's order on birthright citizenship. Several lower courts have previously blocked Trump's bid to restrict the law that states anyone born on US soil is automatically an American citizen.

items.title: Supreme Court to decide constitutionality of Trump's birthright citizenship order

items.content: The Supreme Court said Friday it will decide the legality of President Trump's executive order that seeks to end birthright citizenship​.

ai_summary: The Supreme Court will rule on the interpretation of the US Constitution.
The justices will weigh guarantees to "all persons" born in the country.
Oral arguments are likely early next year, with a ruling in June.
Lower courts previously blocked Trump's bid to restrict birthright citizenship.
The Supreme Court will decide the legality of Trump's executive order.

Trump, who has openly campaigned for the Nobel Peace Prize, had been heavily expected to…

items.title: Trump takes the spotlight, Peace Prize at FIFA World Cup Draw
items.standfirst: Donald Trump was centre stage accepting the first-ever FIFA Peace Prize.
items.content: Donald Trump was centre stage accepting the first-ever FIFA Peace Prize.

items.title: Donald Trump awarded first FIFA 'peace prize' at football World Cup draw
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump was awarded the new FIFA peace prize on Friday at the 2026 World Cup draw — giving the soccer spectacle to set matchups for the quadrennial tournament even more of a Trumpian flair. Trump, who has openly campaigned for the Nobel Peace Price, had been heavily favored to win the newly created FIFA prize. He and FIFA president Gianni Infantino are close allies, and Infantino had made clear that he thought Trump should have won the Nobel for his efforts to broker a ceasefire in Gaza. Analysis by Thando Sibiya, sports consultant.
items.content: President Donald Trump was awarded the new FIFA peace prize on Friday at the 2026 World Cup draw — giving the soccer spectacle to set matchups for the quadrennial tournament even more of a Trumpian flair. Trump, who has openly campaigned for the Nobel Peace Price, had been heavily favored to win the newly created FIFA prize. He and FIFA president Gianni Infantino are close allies, and Infantino had made clear that he thought Trump should have won the Nobel for his efforts to broker a ceasefire in Gaza. Analysis by Thando Sibiya, sports consultant.

items.content: US President Donald Trump receives the inaugural Fifa Peace Prize before the draw for the 2026 Fifa World Cup.

items.content: US President Donald Trump has been awarded FIFA's new peace prize at the draw for next year's World Cup.

items.title: US President Donald Trump named first winner of FIFA Peace Prize
items.standfirst: FIFA on Friday awarded its first peace prize to US President Donald Trump, who described it as "one of the great honours" of his life. Trump received the prize during the 2026 World Cup draw in Washington, DC.
items.content: FIFA on Friday awarded its first peace prize to US President Donald Trump, who described it as "one of the great honours" of his life. Trump received the prize during the 2026 World Cup draw in Washington, DC.

ai_summary: Donald Trump received the first-ever FIFA Peace Prize at the World Cup draw.
The event set matchups for the 2026 quadrennial soccer tournament.
Trump has campaigned for the Nobel Peace Prize previously.
FIFA President Gianni Infantino is a close ally of Trump.
Trump described the prize as "one of the great honors" of his life.

items.title: CDC panel overturns 1991 newborn vaccine policy, triggering warnings of a public health backslide
items.standfirst: A powerful advisory group within the CDC voted Friday to overturn a longstanding precaution designed to protect newborn babies. If the change is approved by the acting director of the agency, the government will no longer universally recommend the hepatitis B vaccine at birth. The shot, which…

If the change is approved by the acting director of the agency, the government will no longer universally recommend the hepatitis B vaccine at birth. The shot, which…

items.content: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has faced swift backlash for its change to government guidance.

items.title: CDC panel votes to stop recommending birth dose of hepatitis B vaccine
items.standfirst: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, with members appointed by RFK Jr., voted to change longstanding recommendations on the hepatitis B vaccine.
items.content: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, with members appointed by RFK Jr., voted to change longstanding recommendations on the hepatitis B vaccine.

items.title: CDC advisers vote to overturn decades-long policy on hepatitis B vaccine for infants
items.standfirst: In a controversial move, the vaccine advisory group reversed a recommendations for universal immunizing of newborns intended to protect them from a virus that attacks the liver.
items.content: In a controversial move, the vaccine advisory group reversed a recommendations for universal immunizing of newborns intended to protect them from a virus that attacks the liver.(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)

items.title: CDC panel to vote Friday on hepatitis B vaccine for newborns
items.standfirst: The CDC's vaccine advisory panel meets Thursday and Friday to discuss recommendations for the hepatitis B vaccine and the schedule of childhood shots.
items.content: The CDC's vaccine advisory panel meets Thursday and Friday to discuss recommendations for the hepatitis B vaccine and the schedule of childhood shots.

ai_summary: A CDC advisory group voted to overturn a newborn vaccine policy from 1991.
The change would stop universal recommendation of the hepatitis B vaccine at birth.
The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices faced backlash for the change.
The vaccine protects against a virus that attacks the liver.
The CDC panel discussed recommendations for childhood shots.

clusters.title: Eurovision in crisis? Israel’s inclusion causes rift – The Latest
clusters.neutral_headline: Eurovision Faces Boycotts Over Israel's Inclusion

items.title: Eurovision in crisis? Israel’s inclusion causes rift – The Latest
items.standfirst: Several countries are boycotting Eurovision after Israel was cleared to compete in the 2026 song contest despite calls for it to be excluded over the war in Gaza. Lucy Hough speaks to our European culture editor, Philip Oltermann – Watch on YouTube Continue reading...
items.content: Several countries are boycotting Eurovision after Israel was cleared to compete in the 2026 song contest despite calls for it to be excluded over the war in Gaza. Lucy Hough speaks to our European culture editor, Philip Oltermann – Watch on YouTube Continue reading...

items.title: Austria to go ahead with Eurovision despite financial impact of boycott
items.standfirst: Host broadcaster says show will not suffer after four countries withdraw from 2026 contest over Israel and GazaAustria has said it will continue with plans to host next year’s Eurovision, in spite of its budget being hit by four countries boycotting the song contest over Israel’s participation and the war in Gaza.At a meeting in Geneva, the national broadcasters that make up the European Broadcasting Union gave the all clear for Israel to take part in next year’s event in Vienna, the contest’s 70th anniversary edition. Continue reading...
items.content: Host broadcaster says show will not suffer after four countries withdraw from 2026 contest over Israel and GazaAustria has said it will continue with plans to host next year’s Eurovision, in spite of its budget being hit by four countries boycotting the song contest over Israel’s participation and the war in Gaza.At a meeting in Geneva, the national broadcasters that make up the European Broadcasting Union gave the all clear for Israel to take part in next year’s event in Vienna, the contest’s 70th anniversary edition. Continue reading...

items.title: Eurovision has faced political boycotts before – how does the latest compare?
items.standfirst: Decision by four countries to pull out over Israel’s inclusion is significant for the contest but crisis may not be existentialThe decision by four European broadcasters to boycott next year’s Eurovision over Israel’s inclusion is undoubtedly a watershed moment in the 70-year history of the song contest.One of the few genuinely popular, non-elitist and pan-European cultural events will be without Spain, one of the “big five” nations in terms of financial contributions; Ireland, which has won the contest more times than any other country bar Sweden; the Netherlands, a 1956 founding member; and Slovenia, symbolic of the EU’s eastward enlargement. Continue reading...
items.content: Decision by four countries to pull out over Israel’s inclusion is significant for the contest but crisis may not be existentialThe decision by four European broadcasters to boycott next year’s Eurovision over Israel’s inclusion is undoubtedly a watershed moment in the 70-year history of the song contest.One of the few genuinely popular, non-elitist and pan-European cultural events will be without Spain, one of the “big five” nations in terms of financial contributions; Ireland, which has won the contest more times than any other country bar Sweden; the Netherlands, a 1956 founding member; and Slovenia, symbolic of the EU’s eastward enlargement. Continue reading...

items.title: Four countries to boycott Eurovision over Israel's participation

items.content: Usually known more for pop anthems and extravagant costumes than for political disagreements, the Eurovision Song Contest is facing a major boycott after a push to eject Israel from the contest was rejected

ai_summary: Several countries are boycotting Eurovision due to Israel's participation.
Four countries withdrew from the 2026 contest over Israel and Gaza.
The European Broadcasting Union cleared Israel to participate.
The boycott is a watershed moment in the contest's history.
The contest will be without Spain, Ireland, Netherlands, and Slovenia.

items.title: Pentagon announces it has killed four men in another boat strike in Pacific
items.standfirst: Strike comes amid congressional turmoil over legality of US attacks on suspected drug smugglersThe Pentagon announced on Thursday that the US military had conducted another deadly strike on a boat suspected of carrying illegal narcotics, killing four men in the eastern Pacific, as questions mount over the legality of the attacks.Video of the new strike was posted on social media by the US southern command, based in Florida, with a statement saying that, at the direction of Pete Hegseth, the defense secretary, “Joint Task Force Southern Spear conducted a lethal kinetic strike on a vessel in international waters operated by a Designated Terrorist Organization”. Continue reading...
items.content: Strike comes amid congressional turmoil over legality of US attacks on suspected drug smugglersThe Pentagon announced on Thursday that the US military had conducted another deadly strike on a boat suspected of carrying illegal narcotics, killing four men in the eastern Pacific, as questions mount over the legality of the attacks.Video of the new strike was posted on social media by the US southern command, based in Florida, with a statement saying that, at the direction of Pete Hegseth, the defense secretary, “Joint Task Force Southern Spear conducted a lethal kinetic strike on a vessel in international waters operated by a Designated Terrorist Organization”. items.title: Patient police say they have recovered Fabergé pendant from man accused of swallowing it
items.standfirst: Six days after alleged incident, evidence emerges without requiring medical intervention, New Zealand police sayPolice say they have recovered a Fabergé egg pendant from a man accused of swallowing the item in a jewellery story.New Zealand police have spent six days monitoring every bowel movement of the suspect, a spokesperson said, and the NZ$33,000 ($19,000) James Bond Octopussy pendant was recovered from his gastrointestinal tract on Thursday night by natural means, without requiring medical intervention. Continue reading...

clusters.title: WATCH: National Guard is not Trump’s ‘private army,’ California AG Bonta says after federal hearing
clusters.neutral_headline: Judge Questions Trump's Control of California National Guard

items.title: WATCH: National Guard is not Trump’s ‘private army,’ California AG Bonta says after federal hearing
items.standfirst: A federal judge on Friday sharply questioned the Trump administration's authority and need to maintain command of California National Guard troops it first deployed to Los Angeles in June following violent protests.
items.content: A federal judge on Friday sharply questioned the Trump administration's authority and need to maintain command of California National Guard troops it first deployed to Los Angeles in June following violent protests.

items.title: Judge challenges rationale for Trump’s control over national guard in California
items.standfirst: Judge seems skeptical of administration’s case and whether any crisis justifying deployment still exists in Los AngelesThe judge presiding over California’s lawsuit against the Trump administration challenged the federal government’s authority and rationale for continuing to maintain command over the national guard troops it deployed to Los Angeles earlier this year.The Trump administration federalized the state’s national guard in June, dispatching about 4,000 troops in response to protests in the city over immigration raids, despite opposition from the state’s governor, Gavin Newsom. The state quickly filed a lawsuit, with Newsom calling the move unprecedented and illegal, and the case has been unfolding in the courts for months. Continue reading...
items.content: Judge seems skeptical of administration’s case and whether any crisis justifying deployment still exists in Los AngelesThe judge presiding over California’s lawsuit against the Trump administration challenged the federal government’s authority and rationale for continuing to maintain command over the national guard troops it deployed to Los Angeles earlier this year.The Trump administration federalized the state’s national guard in June, dispatching about 4,000 troops in response to protests in the city over immigration raids, despite opposition from the state’s governor, Gavin Newsom. The state quickly filed a lawsuit, with Newsom calling the move unprecedented and illegal, and the case has been unfolding in the courts for months. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A federal judge questioned the Trump administration's authority over California National Guard troops.
The judge expressed skepticism about the need for continued deployment in Los Angeles.
The troops were deployed in June following protests over immigration raids.
California's governor opposed the federalization and filed a lawsuit.
The case has been unfolding in the courts for several months.
